intro: Lesquerella confluens, commonly known as the desert lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain oily seeds, which are rich in erucic acid and have industrial applications. Lesquerella confluens thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various desert organisms.
